attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LCC8R8enCYcAsYay75O_description
attribs.current:
[[4d6d1]][[4d6d1]][[4d6d1]][[4d6d1]][[4d6d1]][[4d6d1]]

These numbers may be arranged in any order.
If you dont like these stats you may do 27-point buy with this calculator: http://1-dot-encounter-planner.appspot.com/point-buy-calculator.html

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LCC8zXWnXUzinvvkxqo_description
attribs.current:
Make a token on http://rolladvantage.com/tokenstamp/ upload the token as your character image, and change the character name with this format:

PC Name (Game ID)

This is so the character can be assigned to you and a token can be made even while you are offline. if you fail to follow these instructions the character will eventually get deleted.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LbHN2bW1qnUqQMyHtFB_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 1d4, Damage Type: Piercing, Range: 20/60

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LbHQfqF9B5AhZJNHZXk_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon (see "Improvised Weapons" later in the section). A sling must be loaded to deal any damage when used in this way.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LbHQfqF9B5AhZJNHZXk_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Ranged Weapon, Damage: 1d6, Damage Type: Piercing, Range: 80/320

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LbHR-2Yb9RRW0PJVU4G_description
attribs.current: When you damage a creature with an attack or a spell and the creature's size is larger than yours, you can cause the attack or spell to deal extra damage to the creature. The extra damage equals your level. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LbHR6k9cUf9VpVegHBD_description
attribs.current: You can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of your turns.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LbHS6vP3GKnDmnAyamV_itemcontent
attribs.current: Using a crowbar grants advantage to Strength checks where the crowbar's leverage can be applied.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LbHdpn2yOdFdskL4p62_description
attribs.current:
You have a limited well of stamina that you can draw on to protect yourself from harm. On your turn, you can use a bonus action to regain hit points equal to 1d10 + your fighter level.

Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LbHdtWmHQBieZINYdHB_description
attribs.current:
Starting at 2nd level, you can push yourself beyond your normal limits for a moment. On your turn, you can take one additional action on top of your regular action and a possible bonus action.

Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again. Starting at 17th level, you can use it twice before a rest, but only once on the same turn.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LbHepYbZAlDeH6L4TFX_description
attribs.current: Upon choosing this archetype at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with Tinker’s Tools. You may use them to craft ammunition at half the cost, repair damaged firearms, or even draft and create new ones (DM’s discretion). Some extremely experimental and intricate firearms are only available through crafting.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LbHfj2gZ-TzIGb-YTl9_description
attribs.current:
You have mastered ranged weapons and can make shots that others find impossible. You gain the following benefits:

    Attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged weapon attack rolls.
    Your ranged weapon attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover.
    Before you make an attack with a ranged weapon that you are proficient with, you can choose to take a -5 penalty to the attack roll. If the attack hits, you add +10 to the attack's damage.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LbQZWwFPcleXAuaOd-F_description
attribs.current:
When wielding a one-handed weapon in one hand and no
other weapons, you get a +2 bonus to your damage rolls with
these weapons.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LbUfwPnZZT7WMPSDJAI_description
attribs.current:
You have perfected the art of shooting with your revolver or
hand cannon. You gain the following benefits:
You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls with these weapons.
You cannot be disarmed while wielding a revolver or hand
cannon in one hand and your other hand is free.
When you make an attack with your revolver or hand
cannon and are not holding anything in your other hand,
you can use your bonus action to make two additional
attacks against creatures within its normal range. You do
not add your ability score modifier to the damage of these
attacks, unless that modifier is negative.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LbUlUVmcFk1LKEGAsFf_itemcontent
attribs.current: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LbUtlQlbz2nPsc-f09z_description
attribs.current: You can use the powerful blast and thundering sound of your firearm to shake the resolve of a creature. When making a Charisma (Intimidation) check, you can expend one grit point to gain advantage on the roll.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LbUtrZjMgasvlzZyIX4_description
attribs.current: When you make a firearm attack against a creature, you can expend one grit point to attempt to trip them up and force them back. On a hit, the creature suffers normal damage and must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away from you.

attribs.name: flaws
attribs.current:
What happened to the New Continent Dream?
It came TRUE.
You're lookin' at it.

attribs.name: bonds
attribs.current: You see this (guild) badge? You know what this makes me?  It makes me the law.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LbVWJndgonWLsDDu9nv_description
attribs.current:
Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

The number of attacks increases to three when you reach 11th level in this class and to four when you reach 20th level in this class.

attribs.name: ideals
attribs.current: Power. If I can attain more power, no one will tell me what to do.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LbVtqcb7-nQxyv65pWD_description
attribs.current: If you forgoe a short rest while your allies rest, you are able to gathar 3d8+10gp worth of materials from the environment that can go towards crafting during DTH. At level 10 this ammount increases to 4d8+10gp, and at level 15 this ammount increases to 6d8+10gp. Also, When you reach level 5 having selected this faction, you may now craft up to 50g per day into an item instead of the base ammount. At level 10 this increases to 75g per day. At level 15 this increases to 100g per day. At level 20 this increases to 150g per day. A crafted item still uses your downtime hours, but you only need to spend 50-75% of the item's value in gathered materiels (Depending on rarity).

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LbWQ7nXcapOgafYINmG_description
attribs.current: When you reach 7th level, you add your proficiency bonus to your initiative.  You can also stow a firearm, then draw another firearm as a single object interaction on your turn.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LbvZ8LY7r63GXoA531n_description
attribs.current:
You have inexplicable luck that seems to kick in at just the right moment.

You have 3 luck points. Whenever you make an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, you can spend one luck point to roll an additional d20. You can choose to spend one of your luck points after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined. You choose which of the d20s is used for the attack roll, ability check, or saving throw.

You can also spend one luck point when an attack roll is made against you. Roll a d20, and then choose whether the attack uses the attacker's roll or yours. If more than one creature spends a luck point to influence the outcome of a roll, the points cancel each other out; no additional dice are rolled.

You regain your expended luck points when you finish a long rest.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LcOczp0KQtEPu3cECqG_description
attribs.current: Upon reaching 10th level, you learn how to quickly attempt to fix a jammed gun.  You can spend a grit point to attempt to repair a misfired (but not broken) firearm as a bonus action.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LcYTDZIb8U8MhXJLGKV_description
attribs.current: When you make a firearm attack against a creature, you can expend one grit point to gain advantage on the attack roll.
